capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape, the way he's always been portrayed as this intimidating figure in the wizarding world is quite a misconception. I mean, have you seen his backstory? He was a highly accomplished student at Hogwarts, and yet, he's constantly belittled by everyone around him. It's almost like they're trying to hide the complexity of his character.

Snape, the way he's always been portrayed as this intimidating figure in the wizarding world is quite a misconception. I mean, have you seen his backstory? He was a victim of bullying and abuse himself, which makes him even more complex and sympathetic. I think that's why J.K. Rowling did such a great job of humanizing him in the books.

Snape, he's definitely a complex character in the Harry Potter series. I mean, on one hand, he can come across as really intimidating and strict, but at the same time, there are moments where you see glimpses of his vulnerability and depth. He's got a lot of layers to him, you know?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm a huge fan of Professor McGonagall. I mean, she's an amazing witch and an incredible role model for young witches like myself. Her lineage is indeed pure-blood, and it's no surprise given her family's long history of producing talented wizards. I completely agree with the fact that she's a true blood, and I think it's really admirable how she's carried on the McGonagall name with such pride and distinction.

I'm a bit of an old-fashioned person, I must say. I think it's wonderful that Minerva McGonagall has such a strong lineage and is proud to be a part of the pure-blood wizarding families. It's just so... noble, you know?
